verses.roman:
sagaṇe sacele giyā kaila gaṅgā-snāna
bhaktira mahimā tāhāṅ karila vyākhyāna

synonyms: sa-gaṇe—with His followers; sa-cele—without leaving the clothes; giyā—going; kaila—did; gaṅgā-snāna—bathing in the Ganges; bhaktira—of devotional service; mahimā—glories; tāhāṅ—there; karila—did; vyākhyāna—explanation.
translation: Without even changing His garments, Lord Caitanya took a bath in the Ganges with His companions. There He explained the glories of devotional service.
